unnormalised: ## Flash Sale Frenzy: Faster Than Aunty Sudha's Chai!
normalised: ## Flash Sale Frenzy: Faster Than Aunty Sudha's Chai!

unnormalised: Okay, folks, let's talk about flash sales. You know, those heart-stopping, adrenaline-pumping, credit-card-threatening events that happen faster than you can say "Paneer Tikka Masala"? They're the retail equivalent of a Mumbai local during rush hour – chaotic, intense, and if you snooze, you lose.

unnormalised: We've all been there, right? Sitting peacefully, scrolling through Instagram, when BAM! A flash sale announcement from your favourite online kurta store, "Desi Threads." "Up to 80% off! Only for 2 hours!" Suddenly, your calm Saturday afternoon turns into a frantic race against time, battling other Aunties (and Uncles, let's be honest) for that perfect block-printed saree.

unnormalised: And the best part? By the time you finally manage to add that one thing you *actually* wanted to your cart, it's sold out. "Item no longer available." The digital slap in the face. You end up spending Rs. 5000 on stuff you don't need, but hey, at least you got a "deal," right?

unnormalised: They're like buying property in Gurgaon – blink and the price has doubled! These flash sales are a testament to our inner Indian bargain hunter. We simply cannot resist a good discount, even if it means acquiring enough new cushion covers to fill a 500 sq ft flat. So next time you see that flash sale pop up, brace yourself. Get your Paytm ready. And may the odds be ever in your favour! Just remember to breathe… and maybe hide your credit card from yourself afterwards.
